siteMetadata.title: csnotehub
siteMetadata.subtitle: Tips for CS, IT, and CpE university students!

frontmatter.title: Python Variables
frontmatter.description: Variables in Python does not need to be declared with a data type unlike statically typed languages. This nature of not needing a declared data type is called dynamic typing. You can declare a variable in Python just by assigning a value to it with varName = value

frontmatter.title: Arrays
frontmatter.description: Arrays work similarly to sets in math. It's a collection of elements, but arrays are ordered through an index. The index of an element in an array is just its position from the start starting from index 0.

frontmatter.title: Variables and Data Types
frontmatter.description: Variables in C++ are declared with "DataType varName = value;". The name of the variable can be anyting you want while putting the value during declaration is optional.
